name: What Could Be
tip: When you Birth, first it creates a Child in hand if you don't have one, then raises the Children in your hand by that many points.

name: When I First Held You
tip: Because Birth adds the Child to hand when it resolves, you can't use their points until the next round.

name: The Future
tip: Grow a Child too big and it stops getting better: 10 points and 20 points aren't that different.

name: Posterity
tip: A Child can take up space in your hand, preventing you from drawing.

name: Ancestry
tip: Ancestry is often better played on a much later round, donâ€™t let the 3-cost fool you.

name: Pregnant
tip: If you have 2 Children in hand, Birth will boost BOTH of their points.

name: Cradle
tip: Playing a Child to win a round, instead of holding onto it forever, is often better in the long run.

name: Pass On
tip: In a small deck, the Heirloom value can be huge.

name: Rebirth
tip: Rebirth combines well with cards that reduce their cost.
